website_summaries.verdict: While not a traditional hammock, this collapsible and inexpensive perch doubles as a scratching post.
pros: 2 corrugated cardboard pieces fit together for a comfortable resting post
Cats can rest, or work on their paws with a scratching experience
cons: Corrugated cardboard gets scratched and shredded after heavy use

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I've already bought this item twice and the second time I bought two for my giant 20lb cat. I duct taped two together and I call it her "double-wide." She absolutely loves it and plays on it and sleeps on it a lot! Totally worth it. I took off one star because the two pieces that slide together don't always fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Randolph

customer_reviews.title: My giant cat's favorite thing to scratch.
customer_reviews.text: My 20lb Main Coon loves these. He recently scratched his way through his third one (2 old style and 1 new style). It does take him 6-8 months to completely demolish one. Also, there's no difference between the new and old models except for the colors of the borders. He does move them and knock them over occasionally when scratching the bottom "legs" while standing on the floor, but they have never collapsed due to his weight or size. See pics.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Davis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap enough for my cats to hate it and still feel satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Cheap enough for my cats to hate it and still feel satisfied with my purchase. Should make excellent kindling for our first summer bonfire. Update: Man do I have to eat my words! My two fat cats fight over who gets to sit on this contraption. They lounge, they scratch, and they rub their cute furry faces on the corners. It is holding up just fine. My less fat cat has figured out how to push it all over the house for a more favorable seat. It's fun to find out where it turns up. What a fun product!
customer_reviews.author: mrswanderingsuz

customer_reviews.title: Fat cat approved
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put it together, my 20 lb female staked her claim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it! When I purchased it, it was under $10. I will be keeping an eye out for that price again. We have many cat scratchers around the house, and this is their favorite. The two (12 lbs) cats play and fight on this thing. I do wish it had held up a bit better, but what can I expect with the rough play of two heavy cats. The attached picture is after 3 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two for my furr baby. He loved the big boxes they came in, the packaging paper and the actual scratcher! He jumped out of the box to enjoy his new gifts. If your cat loves scratching, this is the way to go. He scratched every side of it within the first 10 minutes. I would recommend getting two so that your cat can comfortably stretch out!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great toy that was on sale for less than $8.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy that was on sale for less than $8. My kittens have been playing with it for over 20 minutes now and still at it. That is a win in my book. Made of corrugated cardboard similar to the inexpensive scratching boxes. I think it should hold up pretty well. I would not have bought it at regular price not knowing the quality, but now that I have it, even full price of $19 would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Connieb

customer_reviews.title: Cats LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this thing like you wouldn't believe. Bought for kittens, now grown into cats that are too big for the bowl but they still cram themselves awkwardly into it. I've bought two over the years, the first one got torn apart by my dog freaking out over construction sounds. They cats were sadly trying to lie on the broken pieces when I found it. Immediately bought another one and cats are back in the bowl! Attached photo depicts Orlok, my lovely tuxedo cat, as a kitten in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Xerlia

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SCRATCHER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scratcher and it is a good quality for the price. This is my second time buying one and as you can see by the photos and vid, it was/is well loved. That is after well over 6 months of use and my big guy weighs over ten pounds. He loves scratching it when it's flipped either way but he really loved crawling around underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but wish it was double in size!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this patch of grass!! He will sit on it and lay on it. I put treats and cat nip on it when I got it and he fell in love with it. I would totally give this 5 stars if it was about double in size. My cat isn’t huge but he barely fits on it when he sits on it. I also appreciate the openings in the sides so you can put little ribbons or pipe cleaners through them. My cat can see them through the openings on the top and loves to try to catch them. He has scratched at the top a lot and hasn’t pulled any of the grass out yet.
customer_reviews.author: luckysgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats & toddlers
customer_reviews.text: the cats love these things. So does the 2 year old. Jumping on them will cause the cardboard to break. If they're broken, the cats will still use them. A 22lb child reclining on them will cause the cardboard to break. The cats will still use them. Easy to put together, and move where ever you need it to encourage your frisky kitty to stop scratching. For example, if the beast is scratching at the corner of your kitchen where the reflection of the sun hitting the glass happens to fall at 2:30pm everyday, place one of these there. The cat will now scratch the hammock scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be bigger but my cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I wish this was bigger! My calico Maine Coon loves it. She barely fits on it though. I sprinkled cat nip on it and she went crazy rubbing all over it. I have noticed that she doesn't use the brush part very much. I bet she would if it were taller. I would totally buy a larger version of this.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie V

customer_reviews.title: The most coveted spot in the house.
customer_reviews.text: 3 cats, at least 10 different cozy cat beds. Yet the two Petstages Easy Life Scratch, Snuggle and Rest is by far the most popular place to sleep. Well worth the $17...I buy these as gifts for cat owners and have always heard they are 100% cat approved.
customer_reviews.author: One Hip Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Tunnel collapses too easily, injured cat
customer_reviews.text: The cats love the combination tunnel and scratcher. It collapses way too easily however. One of my cats was crouched on one side of the tunnel and another cat playfully attacked her by going over the top of the tunnel. The tunnel collapsed and a sharp corner hit the crouching cat near her ear, drawing blood. The injury didn’t require a trip to the vet fortunately. I immediately put the tunnel away and am trying to figure out the best way to keep the tunnel from folding.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: The idea is nice but poorly executed. Someone got lazy!
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these a purchased about two years ago was made a lot better. This one fits together poorly (pieces are hard to slide into one another and do not go in all of the way). Also, it appears that the bottom sides do not stick out far enough. My cat doesn’t even scratch on this one like she did the old one even with the catnip sprinkled on it. My advice, I’d spend a bit more and get a better product. All she seems to want to do is sit on it occasionally but won’t use it for its main purpose, scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Janell Lewis

customer_reviews.title: So inexpensive and they have never loved any toy more
customer_reviews.text: ...at least apart from teasers, which they love. But after much frustration of these cats never reacting to any toy or even catnip, this was different. Once they had started on this they could not stop, and as you can see in the video they even get jealous over it. And so inexpensive. The cheapest toys are always the ones they like the best, and most especially boxes, so this subverts their expectations nicely as it IS basically just a covered box. But it works!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Collapsed
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, my cat loves these lounges and I've had three of them, but the last one seemed flimsy and didn't fit together correctly, like the others. And then it collapsed with a week after I purchased it. So, I bought a different kind of cat lounge similar--that doesn't have parts that have to be put together. He doesn't like it as much as the Cat Hammock Scratcher, but he didn't get any use out of the last one. Very sad--the first one lasted nearly a year. The second one lasted a couple of months, and the last one lasted only a week or so. And no, my cat hasn't gained weight.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Cat's Meow
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES it. Hugs it, sleeps on it. Is glued to it. That's all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Giordano

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: It's not enough of a hammock for my cat to use it for anything like it. None of my kitties will lay on it. They barely use it for scratching due to its odd shape. If I could get a refund, I'd ask for one but I hoped one of the cats would decide they liked it. Waste of money i couldn't afford to lose but need to replace a hammock with scratch posts that fleas got into so they won't even go near it even though it's clean now. I'd love to see Amazon offer help but don't expect any. Oh, and the catnip didn't even help. But that could be them used to fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: (Two a year are not bad, considering the cost of replacing furniture
customer_reviews.text: This one is must for kittens and cats It has saved all my furniture. My cat hides in it, and attacks and chews apart the cardboard. This is the second one that we bought in the past year. (Two a year are not bad, considering the cost of replacing furniture!) I've attached a video of our cat that has torn apart the scratcher until this last piece and it chewing it up. She has a blast with it, we always know where to find her!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: The catnip helps!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats liked this a lot at first ... you know how they're curious about new things. It was especially purchased for the long-haired kitty, for obvious reasons, but she quickly lost interest. The 20-year-old male has always been nuts about catnip, so he loved to rub on it and hang out. Neither used the "brush tunnel" the way I'd hoped, but they rubbed up against it a little. All in all, I'm really glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Nantz

customer_reviews.title: Holds 9lbs of cat, but moves around a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Holds all 9lbs of my tuxedo cat's chunk. She took to it pretty quickly, but, as most cats tend to do, decided she had no more interest after a few days. I have no doubt in a few months it will be the best spot in the house again. Assembly was intuitive, and it seems very sturdy....but slides EVERYWHERE, which the chunk didn't seem to care for. She also appears to prefer the flat floor cardboard scratchers for actual scratching as this one flips when she tries to scratch it. So, as a chunk lounge, great. As a death weapon sharpener and stretch tool, not so great.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Octavarium

customer_reviews.title: When this arrived the poor workmanship was obvious
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived the poor workmanship was obvious. The colored papers that trim the sides were coming apart. After just two days the basic form was deteriorating. I think the reviewer who questioned whether the item was made by another inferior company might be on to something. This is the poorest quality item I have ever purchased for my pets from amazon. I am so sorry I purchased this. It was a total waste of my money. Due to illness in the family, I ran out of time to return this. So I'm stuck with a useless item that was not at all inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: scribe

customer_reviews.title: Good quality toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality toy and came ready to go! My cat for some reason likes to cuddle up next to it. He's still learning how to actually play with it (yes he's weird). I was really surprised at how durable, good looking and great quality this product was for the price. I recommend buying this to keep your cat active and entertained.
customer_reviews.author: AJOTX

customer_reviews.title: "Broken Roombas" ARE the Best!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what it is about these things, but it seems that ALL cats love them! I volunteer at an animals shelter, and you'll always see one of the cats laying on it. They've become so popular that a lot of people who adopt cats from our shelter actually get one of their own - we like to call them "Broken Roombas". There's actually an entire photo album on facebook dedicate to pictures of cats that were adopted (from the shelter) laying on their "broken roombas" in their new homes:
customer_reviews.author: Tracie B

customer_reviews.title: Great cat scratcher and lounger!
customer_reviews.text: I have four adult cats of different ages and they all have used this to scratch and lay on. The younger cats got the hang of it faster and use it more often. It’s a big hit, especially with the cat nip. I always keep extra cat nip on hand. I will be buying a new one (or two) soon since it wears out with all the scratching but better then ruining my furniture. If you are thinking about it, I recommend going for it. Try placing your cat on it the first time and tempt them with a little bit of cat in front of them they don’t take to it right away. It worked for my older cats.
customer_reviews.author: Louisa Triggs

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well to the large and fiesty ones
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this thing. She lays on it and rips it to shreds. It's standing up very well to her heavy use so far. She's about 17 lbs for reference. She does look a little odd when laying on it because of a little belly hang. I'm surprised how well it has held up so far. She will occasionally turn it over when she rockets off of it but it doesn't seem to phase her much. So far it's my favorite thing I've gotten her (keeps my carpets safe) and probably her second favorite (3 tier ball spinner takes the cake). The photo is from a month and a half of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber7095

customer_reviews.title: I saw potential but my enthusiasm is squashed in disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Construct is two arched scratchboards with an angled cut which appears to be a few inches too short for integrating the boards to form the "V" seen in the promotional photo. Consequently it does not support much weight, the cats sniffed at the catnip provided but the joined scratchers are not firm and are shaky. I am going to try deepening the angled cuts given it is cardboard and try to turn this into the promised hammock ...
customer_reviews.author: Marie-Helene Langevin

customer_reviews.title: sturdy construction and they enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: My cats are notoriously hard to get toys that they enjoy. They do enjoy playing with the balls through the holes in the top, if you have larger cats, the holes one the sides are very very small, and only one of my cats can get their paws through the holes. I sprinkled a little catnip into the holes to get them interested in it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ruetz

customer_reviews.title: Kitten loves her little “arena”
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 9 week old kitten and she loves it. She looks so small in it that my boyfriend calls it her “arena.” We’ve had it for a week and there’s already some bite marks but the kitten sleeps and plays in it every day/night so I’ll definitely buy again once she destroys it. My older cat (3 years) didn’t care much for it but she likes plastic bags more than cardboard boxes so that could be why (and I also didn’t put catnip in it). For size reference, my older cat sat in it once and is 10.5 lbs and fit in it perfectly. So if you have a bigger cat it may hang over the side.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a second time to give the company the benefit of the doubt. Unfortunately - the pieces just don't fit together like they used to years ago. I'm actyally surprised this product is still on the market, taking people's money. I am with all the other reviewers who are real purchasers who say the pieces don't fit, and if you insist on jamming them together the product will break/collapse in a matter of weeks. Don't waste your money. When it was made better years ago, it was an awesome product that my cats used all the time. Will find something else now and am not so trusting of the Petstages brand anymore.
customer_reviews.author: nycindyloo

customer_reviews.title: Cat fight
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Had my doubts but the cats fight for it. It seems like it will hold up for awhile...until the cats scratch it all up. There is scratch surface all over it and the cats can't get to the under surface but the assembly is such that I think I can slide the 2 pieces together in the opposite direction to use the other side. They slide together at the center like an X. You could also easily just leave it in 2 peaces and have 2 small curved sitting things to use up the other scratch side.
customer_reviews.author: cazmonet

customer_reviews.title: Tito says yes!
customer_reviews.text: Tito loves his new scratcher. Sometimes he tips it over but he's kind of a destruct-o-kitty so that's not a big deal. He's a big ole boy, 17ish pounds, and he's perfectly comfy perched on top. Three cheers for the scratchy thingy!
customer_reviews.author: Mekare

customer_reviews.title: Really Bad Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled with ease. Our cat used it for a week and I noticed one side was higher than the other. Upon investigation - found the "hammock" was breaking down. So - I used 6 industrial glue sticks to put it back together. Here are the before and after pictures. It is rock solid now and I could have requested an exchange but I didn't as I really did not have anything else scheduled to do! Don't BUY this Hammock - there is no support where the slots were cut resulting in a short life. My cats don't appear any more motivated to scratch and sleep on this Hammock as they do a regular scratch pad.
customer_reviews.author: MPKramer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this thing
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this thing. He sleeps on it, he hops up onto it and scratches his nails on it before every meal. His relationship with this is hilarious. He defends it from the other cat, who is not allowed to even look at it. The last one we had lasted about three months, our kitty is about 14 pounds, and used it multiple times a day. Super easy to assemble, I would argue quite sturdy, and great to throw some catnip on every once in a while for cat happy times. You can't beat something that does a two for one, both a bed and a scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: TheCourteousGenevievez

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but we had issues
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to eat.....so she tried to eat the fluffy grass on top. I had to remove it. After that she did not feel the toy is interesting enough.... But I found a solution.... Removed a bit of cardboard on the sides and I drop a few kibbles in the openings. Now she loves it. The balls now can come out the sides easily but the cat loves that. So great idea but not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: What can i say, my cats love these!
customer_reviews.text: I basically have one of these in most rooms in my house! My 2 cats love them and prefer sleeping on them! The cardboard is a great scratching medium and they really give the scratchers a workout! My cats are not small and stability is no problem. They love to scratch and i love that they prefer scratching the cardboard over my furniture! I highly recommend these to spoil your cats. You haven’t truly achieved the status of a fully trained cat servant until you bring one of these home!
customer_reviews.author: C. Novak

customer_reviews.title: Doubled the fun - Queen sized!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few weeks ago, but my cat is over 10 lbs and was always drooping over the edge. * This bed may work for small cats and kittens, but didn't cut it for a full my girls. I broke down and bought a second one and ziptied them together (easily poke the tie through the cardboard!). She loves her new bed. Plenty of room to stretch out and sharpen her claws. It's also much more stable and she can't flip the bed over when she jumps off. I highly recommend this (double wide DIY) for cats over 5 pounds that like cardboard beds.
customer_reviews.author: SillyPidgion

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Simply said, my cat LOVES this Hammock Scratcher. While she does use it as a scratching post, I most often find her stretched out on it sleeping her day away. The only other place in the house that even comes close to being her favorite is my pillow (which I discourage because I'm allergic to cats). When I first received this toy, I wasn't sure about it because essentially, it's just two pieces of compressed cardboard. Six months later, it's still in fine shape, and as the title says, she loves it! P.S. for owners of fat cats...my cat is about 16 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Dee

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My kittens love this!! I did have to find different balls, the ones that come with it are quite small. The kittens pop them out and lose them. I found some balls at the store that do fit, just a bit bigger. The avg size balls, about ping pong size, are too big. This is why I deducted stars for sturdy. But the kittens love it. Side note: I wrote the company. Replacement balls are not available for purchase. Kittens lost the ones that came with it. Company said they would send some, yet to be received. Will see if they follow up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats absolutely love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and they both like this. The first one I bought my cat jumped off the edge of it and it cracked and became completely unusable. It lasted for about 6 months before it broke so it was no big deal. I ordered it a second time and it broke in a week. I'm not sure what my cat did to break it this time. The cats could still use it for scratching when it's broken but they refuse to touch it when it's not in it's X shape. My cats are both over 14 lbs so they might've broke it by just being heavy and jumping around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I showed my cat how to play with it, she played for a whole afternoon. The design is good, with 5 holes on the top and 6 holes on the sides. The fake grass also looks vivid. Maybe too vivid that my cat kept pulling it off and swallow. My husband get concerned with that since it is made from plastic.
customer_reviews.author: MEIJUN ZHU

customer_reviews.title: Glad to find!
customer_reviews.text: This was shipped fully assembled which will make it a little more sturdy. Light weight, not made of lasting materials. Base is corrugated cardboard, I did not check makeup of the pole. Considering the low cost, I will have no qualms throwing it away when "dead". If it lasts the entire growth period for my latest two litters I will put on my list to purchase again. UPDATE: After 2 days it had been knocked over at least once. Cardboard circle on bottom not helping. Feather on ball had been eaten & the ball "gutted" - fabric outer cover extremely poor choice of materials.
customer_reviews.author: KLMCats

customer_reviews.title: Favorite scratcher.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a favorite with three of my four cats. They sleep in it and sharpen their claws on it. It does seem to rely a bit on location. At first, I had it by their food and they didn't show much interest. Once I moved it next to my bed, someone was using it 24-7. After about six months, the concentric circles detached from all the nail sharpening. They have continued to try to sharpen their nails on the strips of cardboard, but I think it's time to buy a new one. Of note is that I have other cardboard scratchers, but this is their first choice by a long shot.
customer_reviews.author: two shoesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Don't take it apart
customer_reviews.text: Harder to put together than it looks. The pieces are notched to slide together but cardboard doesn't really slide. As I was trying to put the pieces together it started to bend so I thought I'd I pulled it back out so I could try at a little bit different angle. When I did this the cardboard in the middle of the notch cracked and so I just left it alone. I don't know how this item would work if you kept putting it together and taking it apart for the convenience of being able to pack it away so it doesn't take up so much room.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Cameron

customer_reviews.title: dust collector
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cat Scratcher Lounge knowing it was unlikely gong to be ever used as a scratcher, but was hoping it might be used as a lounger. No dice. I've tried it in all rooms, and in different spaces, both popular with the cats as a lounge space, or a scratching space. They ignore it except to mark it with their cheeks. Their face cheeks. Update: Purchased in June, it's now September. Tried placing in different areas, no change.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Loved
customer_reviews.text: My Panda got this as a birthday present to replace her old one because she loved it so much. She scratches hers quite a bit, but the first was still in good shape for a year or more. Even then it was fine, the cardboard in the “nest” was just a bit soft & torn up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Boynton

customer_reviews.title: My Cat LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: Our senior 16-pound cat LOVES this, and we've had to replace it only a few times over the past 10+ years. It's just her size, and with the concave bottom of the Scratcher helps her cuddle in it when she sleeps as well as assists her in sitting up to groom herself when she's awake (otherwise she "tips" backwards when grooming). She practically lives in it! My slightly younger 8-lb. cat would compete for this Scratcher until I bought another one just for her, though she's more active and rarely uses it.
customer_reviews.author: G.G.

customer_reviews.title: A hit with my cat
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is made of cardboard and plastic grass, and aggressive play will tear it apart. My cat also learned how to fish out the balls and I am not entirely sure where he hides them. But his enthusiastic play and the amount of time he has spent with this simple toy has already paid for the low price, in my mind. I can substitute the balls for nearly any toy. At least he scratches up the cardboard and not my furniture! I'm a fan, and when he destroys this one I will probably order a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: rcg

customer_reviews.title: May help to relax hyper cats with anxiety disorders
customer_reviews.text: Our tamed ex-feral cat absolutely loves this scratcher; it is her favorite "toy." Her former "tunnel" lasted for over a year, despite daily use and massacre. Our cat has some mental scars from being born in and surviving in the wild, including an anxiety disorder and hyperactivity. Our vet had us try calming pheromone sprays/diffusers, medications, waterfalls, music, other toys, changing food/detergents, "play exercise" etc, with very little impact . A few minutes on the scratcher often relaxes her.
customer_reviews.author: Silent Witness

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this! She loves batting the balls ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my cats loves this! One of them likes to eat the grass and chews on the box more than she likes battle the balls around. I've had to superglue the box back together because of her. My other kitten isn't too rough with it and it's held up well. This thing entertains my cats for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My cats are weird and don't really have interest in actual cat beds but they took right to this. One just likes to chew on it...the other loves to scratch on it and then curl up to sleep. It's the perfect little bowl for her...she's a pretty small cat. I leave it outside of my bedroom door as a place for them to scratch instead of the rug under my door. Not sure how long it'll hold up against the chewing but they enjoy it so I'll probably get another one down the road.
customer_reviews.author: TLynn

customer_reviews.title: Great for kittens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this post for my 16-week-old kitten who hadn't had access to a scratching post at the shelter and didn't know what to do with the one we'd bought for her. This hammock scratching post is endless fun for her. She hides under it, lays on tops of it, loves to chase her toys around it, and uses it for her claws every day. Now that she's gotten older and larger, she does knock it over occasionally, but that's to be expected. She also still enjoys scratching on it, though she's gotten used to her posts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Brookins

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy enough
customer_reviews.text: My cat seems vaguely interested, but only occasionally. It has cutouts along the side and when he's playing he'll try to put his paw in, but the box will slide -- it's very light and has a slippery bottom. I also think there are more balls inside than there should be, though I suppose I could remove a few. Don't know about the grass on top, seems to just get in the way. It's not terrible, and as with any cat toy it's hit or miss -- my cat sometimes gets interested, but mostly not.
customer_reviews.author: TomH

customer_reviews.title: Milo approves!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 2 of these previously, which Milo loved, but the tiny balls were easily removed from the box with his claws and lost under the sofa and god knows where else. This new design has larger balls that he can not remove. He’s also a large cat (part Maine Coon, we believe) so I bought 4 this time and taped them together for a larger play area for him. So far so good! Though, he doesn’t seem as interested as before BECAUSE he can’t remove the balls!
customer_reviews.author: HNW

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting cat scratcher
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this thing as it provides way more scratching opportunities for her little cat face without us risking our hands or arms when she doesn't like a certain way we scratch her. I like that there are 2 sets of holes for the arch scratcher to allow the cat to have a fresh cardboard scratching area. Definitely will buy again once ours is beaten and unusable. We have had ours for more than 2 months now which is great!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Meh.....
customer_reviews.text: All 4 of my cats are not that excited by this - it doesn't seem to work for your average cat. It's too light to sustain them when they play - my cats knock it over pretty easily. It's not an effective scratcher since it's so lightweight it doesn't stay stable. It has some minimal use as a lounger /place to lay that is not on the ground but again it moves easily when a cat touches it so it doesn't appear to be the most stable and secure place to lay. Update a month or so later...didn't work as a lounger - it broke under the weight of in car that used it occasionally. Waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: As it basically slots together its extremely simple to go together. I use it to sprinkle cat nip into the honeycomb structure which gets the cats attracted to it. The problem is one of mats is a chewer of cardboard and this breaks apart easily, I have a full corner missing, my other cat loves to lay on it though. So if your cat is very laid back its great if you have a slightly more violent character then plan to replace it quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Scotamazon

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait until my cat decided to gravitate towards it before I made any post and so far she absolutely loves it! She’s a bit older (10) so it’s really hard for her to climb onto things and the height on this is perfectly fine. You have to reposition the pieces so that it doesn’t look like a chair and looks exactly like the picture. Farrah approves! UPDATE: October 6, 2020 Farrah’s absolutely favorite everything! She loves this and sleeps on it
customer_reviews.author: Tinaabeena

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for young cats!
customer_reviews.text: I have got to say that this cat toy is a real hit for my young cats- and apparently, for the older ones, as well, who use it as a spectator sport, as they watch the younger ones play with it. Some other folks have had a problem with the balls inside the toy falling out, but I've turned it upside down- and so have my cats- and none of the balls inside have fallen out. In any case, I was not expecting such a high quality toy for such a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good for *ahem* larger felines.
customer_reviews.text: So I have a large cat. Not fat, but big. Like can stand on her back feet and can reach items on the counter with her paws. A big girl. Well the pictures looked great! So I ordered it and put it together and stuck it under her favorite birdwatching window. All was good. She loves it. However, it’s now just flat. My sweet baby angel’s chonky butt just flattened it out. She still uses it, but sadly it’s not much of a perch anymore. I would say this is good for small and medium cats, but if you have a big boned thicc biscuit Amazon kitty, maybe pass.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Erica B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this chair, she scratches it and uses it as a little bed!
customer_reviews.author: Kec3792

customer_reviews.title: Best for a smaller cat
customer_reviews.text: Initially my cat really liked this -- but I suspect it was because it comes with catnip that you can sprinkle onto it. My cat is basically the size of a baby mountain lion -- all 15 pounds of her. So her big furry self did not fit into this very well. She sat on it, but laying down or curling up was not an option. Great item for smaller fur babies, not so great for mountain lions. Maybe if this came in a larger size? : )
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Fun that occupies the cat
customer_reviews.text: My only regret is not purchasing this box sooner. Toby the cat is very particular about his toys and has rejected many, but not this one. He really enjoys playing with this box. It occupies him when I'm not at home because I drop a few dry treats in the holes and he has to work to get them out. This product is made well and durable. I am very satisfied with this product and it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Tanasy

customer_reviews.title: Terrific cat scratcher and bed!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this scratcher/bed for years. All of my cats love it. I have several around the house on top of shorter cat condos or on a bench. The cats scratch it and then sleep in it. It is the perfect size and shape for all but the largest of cats. They last pretty long too. I have had a couple issues with the feet coming unglued but that is usually after quite a bit of time. It can be easily glued back if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Janeden

customer_reviews.title: My cat loved it !
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kitties love these scratchers ! Unfortunately, on of my kitties barfed on them, and I have not seen her on them, since that time. I cleaned it up, very well, too. My husband said that he has seen her on them, though. I have several styles of these card board scratchers, and they all get attention. They save my carpets !!! So, I will be ordering more. Wish I could figure out how to get my cats to barf on the hardwood floor, that is much easier to clean up !
customer_reviews.author: Thomasina

customer_reviews.title: Our two cats love it
customer_reviews.text: OK so any cat owner should know that reviewing a cat toy is kind of silly, because every cat has a different taste/personality. So I ignored the negative reviews and gave it a shot, and lucked out. Both of our very different cats love it! One of them rarely plays with ANYTHING, but this is his favorite toy ever! The other one plays with just about everything, so it's no shock he loves it, too. The only complaint is it's somewhat easy for them to pull the balls out of the top holes, so we sometimes have to chase the balls down and put them back in.
customer_reviews.author: b.peltz27Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Design fail
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat because she loves cardboard. I saw pictures of other cats laying on it and jumping on it so I figured she may like it. However, the wide V shape just doesn't work - it's very awkward. She hasn't got on it once since I bought it months ago. I'll probably take it apart and use the flat parts in cardboard boxes to at least get some use out of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Season

customer_reviews.title: Popular with the cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats took to this scratcher bed immediately. During nap time and over night there's always a kitty curled up on it. One leg was partly loose on arrival, but I think that was because it was packed with a heavier item in the Amazon box. I taped it underneath so the repair is not visible, and it seems fine now. It does not have a glue or solvent odor like some scratchers have, so I'll probably be buying more of these, even though the price seems a little high.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: My cats absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.text: My cats can be picky and they love this thing! They love scratching on it and sleeping on it. They love it so much I have to keep buying new ones when the cardboard has had enough from scratching. I hate that little specks of cardboard get EVERYWHERE, but my cats love it so I endure. Cons: messy, have to sweep up or vacuume constantly. Pros: cats love it and it last a while before needing to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki Q.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too small.
customer_reviews.text: Cute scratcher / bed but too small for my boys! I have a 17 and 19 pound cat. The 19 pounder keeps trying to sleep in it but he hangs over on all sides. Got to be uncomfortable! I give him points for trying - shipping it out to some friends with smaller cats.
customer_reviews.author: Sumcat

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for Catzilla
customer_reviews.text: Out of all three of my girls, the fat one decided to claim this as her own. She TORE this thing UP and would lay on it all night every night for months. Now it’s destroyed and looks like Godzilla got to it. She absolutely loves this thing and I can’t get rid of it. I tried and she turned angry and bitter. So now I’m stuck with this eye sore in the room because she’s spoiled. Maybe this isn’t meant for fat, destructive, spoiled cats.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: As I say in all my cat item reviews, I have five cats in my house. I mainly was buying this for my four year old cat, as she used to sit in it and sleep in it. We'd joke about her going camping. But now all of the cats love it. I just wish they didn't chew on the top of it. It makes a mess and means I have to replace it more. But hey, that's just the life of having a cat, haha.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Martha

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied with this.
customer_reviews.text: This cat scratcher "hammock" arrived it terrible shape. Three of the four legs were lose in the celephane package it came shipped in. I had to hot glue three of the legs back onto the underside of it before it could attempt to be used. My 14.5 pound cat barely fits curled up on this upside down cardboard dome called a hammock, so she doesn't lay on it for more than a few minutes at a time. My other cat is too large and won't attempt to get on it. The idea of this item is good, but the quality of workmanship and shipping need improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Loobie

customer_reviews.title: I've ordered this kitty cardboard hammock before.  My cat usually loves these for scratching and for napping.
customer_reviews.text: I love these and have ordered a few of them. My cat usually sleeps on it just like the cat in the photo. But for some reason, this last one I ordered has some smell to it that the cat doesn't like. She won't go near it! Weird. So it just sits there and the other one I ordered at the same time (the Urban Bench scratcher) - is the one kitty goes to. Well at least she scratches on something other than furniture. These cardboard scratchers are the bomb! They also usually come with a little packet of catnip. This scratcher can be turned around
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: One of Best
customer_reviews.text: These don't last as long as carpeted scratching posts but one of my cats perfers cardboard posts to carpet. Thiis design is one of his favorites. He's a 17 poound cat. It's a prized napping spot so I bought several. He chooses this over his cat beds and scratching posts. If you have multiple cats, I'd recommend offering various textures and styles of scratching posts and cat trees. It makes a difference because they each have individual preferences.
customer_reviews.author: fyyfx

customer_reviews.title: Stay at home cat mom? Keep them busy with this!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are very picky and as soon as this was on the floor they were both playing with it!!! Great value and toy. Especially for keeping them busy while I work!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Swing

customer_reviews.title: 1 week and not a scratch......
customer_reviews.text: Is there an age limit? My 7-9 week old kitten doesn’t even pay any attention to this? Even after I rubbed in the cat nip.. My wofe found this little vermin at apron 5 weeks old in mall parking lot, wormy and fea ridden weighing only 3/4 of a pound. $300.00 later and 2 weeks he weighs 2lbs. He appears he’s going to be a big’in. He got really big feet. We have had his claws cut twice a;ready and he tried nursing on my Great Dane; She JUMPED OUT OF HER SKIN ! The bastard seems to want to scratch my King Chair. I’m open for ideas before he goes off a bridge in a burlap sack.
customer_reviews.author: JLee

customer_reviews.title: The cat's LOVE this but...
customer_reviews.text: My two cats love this thing. They Scratch on it, lay on it, play on it. But unless you want to vacuum up around it literally every time they use it, i would suggest something different. But... the cats do love it and its for them not for me... so 4 stars lol. But seriously its a pile of torn up cardboard all over the floor daily till eventually you replace it or move to a different product. If you have declawed cats ( on no ) then they would still love this thing to lay on especially if you sprinkle a little nip on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Both the 8 year old and the kitten love it.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this back in December and my big kitty fell in love with it instantly. He loves playing and laying on it. Occasionally he loses the balls, but they're easy enough to find usually. We just got a kitten and he entertained himself with this for probably a solid hour and a half. I'm buying another one since the big kitty seemed jealous that the little one had taken over his favorite toy. Absolutely fantastic toy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fay

customer_reviews.title: For small cats or kittens
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller that it showed. It’s more for kittens. My cats are too big to go through it.
customer_reviews.author: iraida17

customer_reviews.title: A place to knead and sit!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about this product and how much use my kitten would get out of it, but she seems to like it just fine! It's entirely made out of cardboard, with the "grass" being just a strip of cardboard decoration that does not stick to the side, leaving a little gap. It comes in 2 pieces and you fit the slotted ends together to create this "hammock". It isn't the sturdiest, as it moves when you put weight on it, but it does support the weight of my kitten (4 pounds) and she lies, jumps, kneads and plays on this thing. It also comes with a bag of catnip.
customer_reviews.author: soccer mom

customer_reviews.title: I'm on my 3rd one because I love it so much!
customer_reviews.text: My staff bought the first one for me because I was clawing the rug. With a little catnip, I was on this scratcher like a bee on honey. I use the top, the bottom and everything in between, plus I nap here. It's also a great place to sit and stare at my staff when I want food or want to feel superior. It is made of heavy cardboard so it won't last forever, but it does last a good amount of time for the price. I'm worth it regardless but I highly recommend this to any pet staff looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann W

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bought almost the exact same thing at TJ Maxx a few years ago and my cat (who doesn't play with any toys) loves to rub his face on the brush. When that one got pretty worn I searched for another. This one is the same size and the right price. The nice thing about the one from TJ Maxx (and this one too) is when the brush started to pull out from him rubbing it so much I was able to just push it back into the corrugated cardboard bottom wherever I wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Kittens love this toy!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these, almost more than my kittens do. I fostered a blind kitten that would play with this for long periods of time. He was always successful at getting the balls out. Keeps them occupied for a long time. Because it is cardboard, I probably use more than average person, but I have to maintain cleanliness & sanitary conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Peterson

customer_reviews.title: My Cat approves
customer_reviews.text: Great, I wanted one that my cat could chill on after getting out her frustrations on her hard life at home. I actually ended up having it upside down for her because she kept getting a bit too rough and knocking it over. Once I placed it upside down it was a bit harder for her to knock over. I definitely see potential in this one lasting longer than others I have purchased. But who knows there may be a day where she goes all out and obliterates it because I got her the wrong type of Fancy Feast.
customer_reviews.author: JVG

customer_reviews.title: Favorite sleep spot
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loves it so much I bought one for my daughter’s mature cats & they like it too. It’s a favorite sleep spot & when you sprinkle w/ catnip the fun begins. Catnip will fall out holes onto floors. Will definitely be replaced when all scratched out.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately broke in half.  Didn't last.  I wish it had.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I have ordered 2 of these and both broke in half where the pieces fit together within less than a week. I have 8 cats and some of them weigh around 13-14 pounds but 2 of them are 9 month old kittens and are on the small size. I was very disappointed because my cats all seemed to have loved them and I considered getting several more. Hopefully they can redesign them to be more sturdy. I would love to be a test household to see if a redesigned version lasts longer. It's a great idea and style just no sturdy enough for my cats.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves X-shaped scratching post
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the shaped of this scratching pad. She can sit up higher, and stretch out to scratch. Onl,y problem is she is overweight and eventually the joint breaks! But it lasts for many months and I have bought replacements since they are economically priced
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rabbit loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a rabbit - a 7lb angora. After ripping off the glued on trim and discarding the catnip, I assembled and gave to my rabbit. It is very sturdy and he loves to jump on top or run through the bottom. This cardboard scratcher is perfect for rabbits as they can safely chew it, but also it snags loose fur. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: AwkwardSoul

customer_reviews.title: Our girls love it!
customer_reviews.text: I barely even got it out of the box before the cats were there to investigate! They started playing with it RIGHT away! They were SO excited about it, I had to put it away for the first few nights...so we didn’t have to listen to the tinkle balls all night long! 🤣 Somehow, I didn’t expect it to be fully assembled when I got it but, that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Miller

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for kittens/small cat
customer_reviews.text: The first time my cat tried it he fell off of it and I took him a few days to get up the nerve to go back on it. After that we wedged it into a space where he could not knock it over so it was OK. However, it is not durable. Our cat is 15 pounds and he destroyed it in less than a month. We separated it into two parts and one half is still usable.
customer_reviews.author: SusanC

customer_reviews.title: A grand item of enjoyment for my cats
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these, very good. Adopted a 2nd cat, no problem, only one cat cared about this thing. Adopted a tertiary cat, big problem, dispute over who gets to scratch, snuggle, and rest at which times of day. Made a big investment of $15.99 and now both girls can scratch, snuggle, and rest at the same time - great success!
customer_reviews.author: Cole757

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I looked at this product online and the reviews were quite good. My cats have always enjoyed a similar lounge and this was going to be great for them. When it arrived and I tried putting it together, the pieces didn't connect and my cats could fall out easily! I was so disappointed. Amazon was kind enough for a return and also to send me another one at no cost. I should receive it today and hoping the new one will work.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Harris

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats loves these scratchers. He scratches and lounges on it. He is about 12 lbs. And has broken his first one after much use. I bought him this new one, which he enjoys, but he also plays on the old one, so now he has two. I never see his brother on these, so I guess it's right for some cats. You know how cats are.
customer_reviews.author: Fritzi Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: My cat adores this, for scratching and for sleeping. However, this was my second purchase in four months because the thing keeps snapping in two. She only weighs 7 lbs and should be able to act like a cat and jump without it collapsing. This replacement only lasted a little over a month but my return window is unfortunately closed.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: A must try, your cat will love it!
customer_reviews.text: No more scratching up my furniture! The perfect thing for my cat! It's a scratching post, it's a bed, I don't care my cat loves it' Cheap looking but effective, This cat hammock comes in only in 2 pieces to assemble. Just push together into the slots on each sections, open the cat nip pouch that comes with it put some onto the hammock and just watch your cat enjoy scratching and sleeping on it. leaving your furniture alone, no need to buy lavender sprays just for under $20.00 it took care of my problem. A most try!
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Saved my furniture. Works for large size cat.
customer_reviews.text: Our large cat loves it. He scratches on it and sits on it every day. It fell over once when he was extra wound up and trying to run in circles on it but it just surprised him. Good value. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ccpanel

customer_reviews.title: Cat not interested.
customer_reviews.text: Product went together easily and is pretty sturdy. Our cat is part Mainecoon and rather long. He sat on it twice but didn't like its instability. It didn't collapse, it was just a little uneven when he was trying to situate himself on it. Then he gave up. I also took it apart and gave it to him in the 2 parts but even as regular scratchers, he didn't want anything to do with them, which is weird.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it. Lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved the first one of these that I got several years ago. They finally broke it and had to replace, and surprise, it is now half the price that I paid last time. I have four cats, and a couple are about 15 pounds each. As I said, it eventually broke, but I got my money’s worth. I place it in front of a low window, and they will sit on this scratcher all day long while looking out the window.
customer_reviews.author: docnarc

product_meta.title: Petstages Cardboard Cat Scratchers - Cat Scratcher Lounge and Cat Games
product_meta.description: Style:Easy Life LoungeIt’s easy living with the Easy Life Hammock and Scratcher by Petstages. This sturdy, basic hammock is sure to be your kitty’s favorite perch and scratching post. Corrugate material is great for scratching, and encourages kitty to scratch their own furniture, not yours. Best of all, it’s infused with catnip, so your kitty will love the scent! Most cats stay inside all of their lives, separated from the stimulating, engaging activities that are naturally available outside of the house. To help address your cat's instinctual needs, Invironment products offer a variety of natural materials, textures and activities to provide the Invironment that kitty craves, making them a safe and happy cat!
feature_bullets: 2-IN-1 SCRATCH & NAP: Petstages Easy Life Hammock Cat Scratcher is made from sturdy corrugated cardboard that provides a safe base for lounging kitties to rest and keep their claws trimmed.
COMPACT & EASY TO ASSEMBLE: The unique "X" design of the Easy Life Hammock Scratcher is easy to assemble and take down with two corrugated pieces that slide together to fit. Great for small spaces!

ENCOURAGES POSITIVE SCRATCHING HABITS: Made to mimic the feel of real bark, the extra thick corrugated cardboard of the Easy Life Hammock Cat Scratcher is designed to keep your kitties attention off your furniture.
CATNIP INCLUDED: Comes with catnip to help keep curious kitties interested and shy kitties more comfortable and engaged.
PLAY IT SAFE: No toy is indestructible. Do not leave toys with unsupervised pets. Remove and replace toy if damaged.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
